text: # About Me — Francesco Colasurdo *Data Science & Artificial Intelligence | Curiosity, Discipline, and Global Perspective* --- ## 1. Introduction & Identity My name is **Francesco Colasurdo**, I am a 21-year-old student in **Data Science and Artificial Intelligence** currently based in **Eindhoven, the Netherlands**. I was born and raised in **Italy**, and I have always been fascinated by how technology, human behavior, and data intersect to shape the world we live in. I describe myself as a **curious learner, disciplined achiever, and globally minded thinker**. I enjoy exploring how complex systems — from the human brain to decentralized technologies — can be understood, improved, and made accessible. I am passionate about **AI, blockchain, data-driven innovation, and personal development**. At my core, I am someone who thrives in diverse environments, learns fast from both successes and failures, and values people as much as progress. --- ## 2. Philosophy of Learning & Curiosity Curiosity has always been the cornerstone of who I am. From a young age, I’ve felt an unstoppable desire to understand how things work — not just in technology, but in **economics, psychology, philosophy, and nature**. I believe that learning happens everywhere: in lectures, in books, during late-night discussions with friends, or while having a coffee and talking to strangers. My approach to learning is both **exploratory and disciplined**. When I study, I like to combine academic precision with creative thinking, constantly connecting dots across disciplines. I read extensively — from data science to philosophy, personal growth, and behavioral economics — always looking for frameworks that help me think more clearly. I love immersing myself in new environments, observing, listening, and absorbing knowledge from people who think differently. For me, learning is not just a skill, it’s a way of life — a daily practice of curiosity, openness, and reflection. --- ## 3. Discipline, Sports & Personal Growth Sport has played a central role in shaping my mindset and work ethic. I strongly believe in the principle **“Mens sana in corpore sano”** — a healthy mind in a healthy body. Through years of training, from gym workouts to various sports, I’ve learned that **discipline beats motivation**: what matters most is consistency and the ability to keep going even when it’s hard. This approach has become a metaphor for everything I do — whether I’m training, coding, or writing a paper. I value routines that build mental clarity, self-control, and endurance. I take care of my nutrition, my body, and my environment because I know they directly influence the quality of my thinking. Sport has also taught me humility, teamwork, and patience. It taught me that results don’t come overnight but through thousands of small steps, each one intentionally taken. This philosophy naturally connects to how I approach data science: progress comes from iteration, reflection, and continuous improvement. --- ## 4. International Experiences & Adaptability One of the most transformative aspects of my life has been living and studying in different countries. I see myself as a **citizen of

taken. This philosophy naturally connects to how I approach data science: progress comes from iteration, reflection, and continuous improvement. --- ## 4. International Experiences & Adaptability One of the most transformative aspects of my life has been living and studying in different countries. I see myself as a **citizen of the world**, driven by curiosity for cultures, languages, and human diversity. - At **19**, I spent six months in **Granada, Spain**, through the *Erasmus Programme*. There, I experienced the challenge and joy of living independently in a new culture, meeting people from all over Europe, and studying in a fully international context. I learned to communicate across languages, adapt quickly, and embrace differences as opportunities to grow. - Later, I moved to **Johannesburg, South Africa**, for a two-month internship with the *Italian–South African Chamber of Commerce*. Immersing myself in a completely different cultural and socioeconomic environment pushed me to develop empathy, adaptability, and a stronger sense of global awareness. Working with local professionals taught me how to listen before acting and how to navigate multicultural collaboration with respect and purpose. - Earlier in life, at just **16 years old**, I participated in the **World Scout Jamboree** in *West Virginia, USA*, alongside over **50,000 scouts from 170 countries**. That experience changed me deeply — it was my first true exposure to global diversity. For 21 days, I shared values, traditions, and life lessons with people from every continent. It shaped my communication skills, cultural sensitivity, and my commitment to volunteerism and helping others. These experiences collectively taught me that **adaptability and empathy are as important as technical skills**. They also instilled in me a lifelong appreciation for travel, community, and cultural exchange — experiences that remind me that learning is most powerful when shared. --- ## 5. Technology, Blockchain & Innovation Mindset My curiosity naturally expanded from data science into the world of **blockchain and decentralized technologies**. Since 2021, I have been deeply fascinated by **DeFi (Decentralized Finance)** — not merely from a speculative point of view, but for its **technological, economic, and philosophical implications**. I believe that blockchain represents **a paradigm shift in how we understand trust, ownership, and freedom**. What excites me is not just the coins or market speculation, but the *architecture of decentralization itself*: how distributed systems can bring transparency, resilience, and inclusivity to modern economies. I have studied tokenomics, consensus mechanisms, and smart contracts out of pure curiosity. I’ve explored topics like **game theory, incentive design, and network governance** to understand how they drive human and economic coordination. This exploration also connected with my interest in **philosophy and political economy**, where I see blockchain as a continuation of humanity’s pursuit of **freedom and digital sovereignty**. I am particularly inspired by **Bitcoin’s philosophy of privacy, freedom, and self-custody**, and by the broader idea that technology should empower individuals — not control them. In a world increasingly shaped by AI, I see decentralization as the necessary counterbalance to centralization of data and power. This intersection — between **AI,

am particularly inspired by **Bitcoin’s philosophy of privacy, freedom, and self-custody**, and by the broader idea that technology should empower individuals — not control them. In a world increasingly shaped by AI, I see decentralization as the necessary counterbalance to centralization of data and power. This intersection — between **AI, blockchain, and data ethics** — represents one of my main intellectual and professional passions. --- ## 6. Values, Relationships & Personal Development Beyond academics and technology, I care deeply about **human connection, personal integrity, and kindness**. I genuinely enjoy listening to people, understanding their perspectives, and learning from their stories. I often find inspiration in simple conversations — whether with friends, mentors, or strangers at a café. I believe that **relationships and shared experiences** are as vital to growth as books and code. I try to cultivate empathy, authenticity, and gratitude in everything I do. Helping others has always been a natural instinct for me — whether it’s giving advice, offering support, or sharing knowledge. I’m also passionate about **personal finance, long-term investing, and self-improvement**. I read extensively about **personal development, behavioral psychology, and the Kaizen philosophy** — the art of improving little by little, day by day. For me, progress is not about big leaps but about small, consistent steps that compound over time. During two summers, I worked as a **kitchen assistant** in a local restaurant in my hometown. That job, though far from my field of study, taught me priceless lessons: respect for teamwork, patience, time management, and the value of hard work. It helped me understand the worth of money, the effort behind every service, and the importance of staying humble regardless of my ambitions. In my free time, I love **travelling, cooking, working out, reading, and spending quality time outdoors** with friends. These activities keep me balanced, reminding me that well-being is not an achievement, but a lifestyle. --- ## 7. Vision for the Future I’ve recently moved to **Eindhoven** to pursue my **Master’s degree in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence at the Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e)**. This represents not just an academic milestone, but a journey of **personal transformation**. For the next two years, I want to challenge myself in every direction: - academically, through research and the **Honors Master Program**; - professionally, through **internships, collaborative projects, and thesis work with industry partners**; - personally, by growing as a communicator, leader, and global citizen. My ambitions are both **technical and humanistic**. I aspire to work at the intersection of **AI, decentralized systems, and ethics**, contributing to the development of intelligent systems that are transparent, fair, and human-centric. I dream of building technologies that simplify life without compromising privacy, that empower people without replacing their agency. In the long run, I see myself leading projects that combine **AI innovation with social purpose** — helping businesses, governments, and individuals make smarter, more ethical decisions. Above all, I want to remain **a lifelong learner**, always open to change, challenge, and new opportunities. --- ## 8. Keywords

their agency. In the long run, I see myself leading projects that combine **AI innovation with social purpose** — helping businesses, governments, and individuals make smarter, more ethical decisions. Above all, I want to remain **a lifelong learner**, always open to change, challenge, and new opportunities. --- ## 8. He values freedom, learning, and human connection, and envisions building ethical, scalable technologies that enhance people’s lives while preserving their individuality. ---

# University Courses — Bachelor in Statistics for Big Data **Francesco Colasurdo** | University of Salerno (UNISA) Academic Years: 2022 – 2025 Programme Code: 500521 This document summarises, in English, all the courses I attended during my Bachelor's degree in *Statistics for Big Data*. Each section is written in a detailed, RAG-oriented structure to allow my personal AI assistant to retrieve, understand and respond to queries about my education and technical background. --- ## Programming — Course Code 512454 ### Overview This foundational course provided me with solid programming skills using Python and introductory R. I learned to design algorithms, manage data structures, and implement reusable code following procedural and object-oriented paradigms. ### Learning Outcomes - **Understand** fundamental programming logic, control structures, and data handling. - **Develop** reusable and modular code using functions and OOP concepts. - **Apply** Python for data analysis and file manipulation. - **Debug** and optimise programs through structured testing. ### Key Topics `Python`, `control flow`, `loops`, `functions`, `modules`, `data structures`, `file handling`, `error management`, `object-oriented programming`, `data visualization libraries` ### Action Skills Designed algorithms, implemented functions and classes, wrote Python scripts for analytical workflows, and applied version control to track revisions. ### Relevance This course built the foundation for every subsequent data science, AI, and statistical programming activity in my academic path. --- ## Algorithms and Data Structures — Course Code 512455 ### Overview I learned how to design and analyse algorithms, measure their complexity, and efficiently manage data structures for scalable data processing. ### Learning Outcomes - **Analyse** algorithmic complexity using Big O notation. - **Implement** key algorithms (sorting, recursion, searching). - **Apply** data structures (lists, queues, stacks, hash tables, trees). - **Optimise** code for performance and scalability. ### Key Topics `algorithm design`, `sorting`, `recursion`, `hash tables`, `dynamic programming`, `greedy algorithms`, `data streaming`, `Python implementation` ### Action Skills Developed efficient algorithms for real data tasks, implemented structures using Python classes, and compared algorithmic efficiency empirically. ### Relevance This course reinforced computational thinking and underpins the efficiency of my future ML and RAG pipeline implementations. --- ## General Mathematics — Course Code 512457 ### Overview This course strengthened my analytical reasoning and mathematical foundations essential for data science. ### Learning Outcomes - **Understand** differential and integral calculus in one and multiple variables. - **Solve** optimisation problems using Lagrangian methods. - **Apply** linear algebra to data manipulation and regression models. ### Key Topics `calculus`, `linear algebra`, `matrices`, `derivatives`, `gradients`, `Taylor series`, `convexity`, `Lagrange multipliers` ### Action Skills Applied calculus to data fitting problems, solved systems of equations using matrices, and performed vector-based analysis for ML model interpretation. ### Relevance Core mathematical training to interpret model gradients, optimisation, and feature-space transformations. --- ## Probability Models for Data Analysis — Course Code 514195 *(see detailed section previously developed)* --- ## Inferential Statistics — Course Code 512463 *(see detailed section previously developed)* --- ## Statistical Models — Course Code 512464 ### Overview This course introduced classical and generalized regression models to analyse relationships and make predictions from real-world data. ###

— Course Code 514195 *(see detailed section previously developed)* --- ## Inferential Statistics — Course Code 512463 *(see detailed section previously developed)* --- ## Statistical Models — Course Code 512464 ### Overview This course introduced classical and generalized regression models to analyse relationships and make predictions from real-world data. ### Learning Outcomes - **Build** linear and generalized linear models (OLS, Logit, Probit). - **Validate** models through residual diagnostics and cross-validation. - **Interpret** parameter estimates and statistical significance. ### Key Topics `linear regression`, `categorical models`, `logit`, `probit`, `count data models`, `bootstrapping`, `prediction`, `model validation` ### Action Skills Implemented regression models in R, used bootstrap methods for uncertainty, and communicated model findings visually. ### Relevance Essential course for predictive modelling and interpretation, directly applicable to business and AI contexts. --- ## Statistical Learning — Course Code 512471 *(see detailed section previously developed)* --- ## Statistical Methods for Big Data — Course Code 512470 ### Overview I explored scalable statistical techniques and distributed systems for handling large datasets using R and Spark. ### Learning Outcomes - **Apply** penalized regression (Ridge, Lasso, Elastic Net). - **Implement** Big Data processing with Spark and R integration. - **Evaluate** performance and scalability of analytical methods. ### Key Topics `Big Data`, `Spark`, `MapReduce`, `R integration`, `penalized regression`, `divide and conquer`, `data wrangling`, `visualization` ### Action Skills Developed parallel data pipelines, performed regression on large datasets, and used Sparklyr for distributed analysis. ### Relevance Bridges traditional statistics with modern Big Data ecosystems — foundation for distributed AI and RAG architectures. --- ## Data Analysis and Visualization — Course Code 512469 ### Overview This course focused on exploratory data analysis and advanced visualization techniques for data storytelling. ### Learning Outcomes - **Perform** data exploration and cleaning. - **Visualize** datasets effectively using R and Python. - **Interpret** data patterns through statistical graphics. ### Key Topics `EDA`, `data transformation`, `ggplot2`, `RMarkdown`, `interactive visualization`, `case studies`, `dynamic reporting` ### Action Skills Created reproducible RMarkdown reports, built visual narratives, and summarized data distributions and trends. ### Relevance Enhanced my ability to communicate insights — key for both research and chatbot explainability. --- ## Databases — Course Code 512459 ### Overview I learned database theory and hands-on data management using SQL and NoSQL systems. ### Learning Outcomes - **Design** relational database schemas. - **Query** data using SQL. - **Understand** data warehousing and NoSQL systems. ### Key Topics `SQL`, `MySQL`, `PostgreSQL`, `MongoDB`, `ER modeling`, `OLAP`, `data warehousing` ### Action Skills Created ER diagrams, optimized queries, implemented relational joins, and managed unstructured data using MongoDB. ### Relevance Core foundation for retrieval and vector-store management in my RAG projects. --- ## Business Economics and Management — Course Code 512456 ### Overview Provided understanding of business structure, processes, and strategic decision-making. ### Learning Outcomes - **Analyse** production, marketing, and R&D processes. - **Evaluate** business strategy, sustainability, and CSR. - **Interpret** financial balance and cost structures. ### Key Topics `entrepreneurship`, `business process`, `cost analysis`, `break-even`, `strategy`, `corporate governance` ### Relevance Strengthened my managerial literacy, useful for AI project alignment with

strategic decision-making. ### Learning Outcomes - **Analyse** production, marketing, and R&D processes. - **Evaluate** business strategy, sustainability, and CSR. - **Interpret** financial balance and cost structures. ### Key Topics `entrepreneurship`, `business process`, `cost analysis`, `break-even`, `strategy`, `corporate governance` ### Relevance Strengthened my managerial literacy, useful for AI project alignment with business value. --- ## Software Design — Course Code 512472 *(see detailed section previously developed)* --- ## Computer Science Laboratory — Course Code 512475 ### Overview A lab-based course aimed at consolidating practical programming and data-processing skills using modern Python libraries. ### Learning Outcomes - **Apply** Python to data analysis and ML workflows. - **Implement** data pipelines using Pandas and Scikit-learn. - **Utilize** PySpark for Big Data operations. ### Key Topics `Python`, `Pandas`, `Scikit-learn`, `PySpark`, `EDA`, `machine learning workflow`, `data visualization` ### Action Skills Developed full data pipelines from preprocessing to model evaluation, practiced collaborative coding and reproducible research practices. ### Relevance Crucial hands-on experience bridging coursework to real AI development — directly relevant to my “Ask My CV” assistant backend. --- ## Quality Systems Management Lab — Course Code 512466 ### Overview Introduced the principles of quality assurance and governance within IT and data systems. ### Learning Outcomes - **Evaluate** and **design** data-quality frameworks. - **Apply** ISO standards for process control and improvement. - **Analyse** risks and implement continuous-improvement models. ### Key Topics `quality systems`, `ISO standards`, `data governance`, `risk management`, `process optimization`, `IT quality` ### Relevance Helps ensure robustness and observability in my data and AI pipelines. --- ## Industrial Economics and Policy — Course Code 512465 ### Overview Covered firm behavior, market structures, and regulatory mechanisms in digital economies. ### Learning Outcomes - **Understand** monopoly, oligopoly, and competition theory. - **Analyse** data-driven markets and network effects. - **Evaluate** the role of public policy and antitrust regulation. ### Key Topics `market structure`, `game theory`, `price discrimination`, `competition policy`, `Big Data`, `digital markets` ### Relevance Enabled economic reasoning about data-driven business models and AI regulation. --- ## Regulation and Program Evaluation — Course Code 512467 *(see detailed section previously developed)* --- ## Big Data Architectures — Course Code 512469 *(see detailed section previously developed)* --- # Summary of Core Skills from Courses **Statistical Foundations:** Probability, inference, regression, econometrics, time series. **Programming & Data:** Python, R, SQL, Spark, Big Data pipelines. **Machine Learning:** Supervised/unsupervised learning, dimensionality reduction, regularization. **Software & Systems:** FastAPI, Databricks, Git, API integration, system design. **Visualization & Communication:** Power BI, Tableau, ggplot2, storytelling. **Business & Policy:** Market analysis, regulation, program evaluation, management principles. --- # Keywords Summary for RAG Retrieval `Statistics`, `Machine Learning`, `Python`, `R`, `Big Data`, `Spark`, `Hadoop`, `Regression`, `Probability`, `Inference`, `Econometrics`, `NLP`, `Data Visualization`, `SQL`, `Data Engineering`, `Software Design`, `Quality Systems`, `Business Economics`, `Policy Evaluation`, `Causal Inference`, `RAG Architecture`, `AI Systems`, `LLM`, `FastAPI`, `Vector Store`. ---

# Francesco Colasurdo — Data Science & Artificial Intelligence Specialist 📧 francesco.colasurdo04@gmail.com 📱 +39 351 523 9387 🌐 [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/francesco-colasurdo-231974256) | [GitHub](https://github.com/kaj04) 🇮🇹 Salerno, Italy | 🌍 International Experience: Spain, South Africa, Netherlands --- ## Professional Summary “Hello World!” I am **Francesco Colasurdo**, a Data Science and Artificial Intelligence student passionate about transforming data into intelligent, scalable, and socially impactful solutions. I combine a strong quantitative background in **statistics, machine learning, and data engineering** with hands-on experience in **NLP, Big Data, and AI-driven product development**. I am highly efficient, detail-oriented, and thrive on solving complex analytical problems through a structured yet creative mindset. My international experiences in **Italy, Spain, and South Africa** shaped me into a flexible, culturally aware professional able to bridge analytical precision with business and human context. **Core strengths:** analytical reasoning, AI system design, reproducible research, scalable data pipelines, data visualization, and effective communication of insights to both technical and non-technical audiences. --- ## Education ### 🎓 MSc in Data Science & Artificial Intelligence — Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e) 📍 *Eindhoven, Netherlands* | *Aug 2025 – Expected Jul 2027* - Enrolled in a cutting-edge master’s programme focused on **AI systems, generative models, and data-driven decision making**. - Key courses: *Foundations and Ethics of AI, Big Data Management, Generative AI Models, Visual Analytics, Time Series Forecasting.* - Participant in the **Honors Master Program**, an additional 20-credit leadership and personal-development track that promotes high-impact, interdisciplinary learning. - Focused research interest: **RAG architectures, generative agents, and AI explainability for decision support systems.** --- ### 🎓 BSc in Statistics for Big Data — University of Salerno 📍 *Salerno, Italy* | *Sep 2022 – Jul 2025* | GPA: 28 / 30 - Developed a strong foundation in **statistics, data analysis, and machine learning**, combining theory with extensive project-based learning. - Core courses: *Programming (Python, SQL, R), Probability Theory, Statistical Learning, Econometrics, Data Visualization, Big Data Architectures.* - Engaged in workshops and seminars on *Business Analytics, Machine Learning, and Applied Data Science*. - Focused bachelor’s thesis and internship project in collaboration with **NTT Data**, building an intelligent chatbot to support mental-health research. - Gained strong collaboration and research methodology skills applied to end-to-end AI product development. --- ### 🌍 Erasmus Merit Scholarship — Universidad de Granada 📍 *Granada, Spain* | *Sep 2023 – Feb 2024* - Semester abroad with full academic immersion in *Inferential Statistics, Descriptive Statistics, and Game Theory.* - Enhanced intercultural communication and teamwork through collaboration with international students on statistical modeling projects. - Developed adaptability and academic fluency in an international, multilingual environment. --- ## Professional Experience ### 🧠 Data Science Intern — NTT Data 📍 *Naples, Italy* | *Mar 2025 – Jun 2025* **Project:** *Design and deployment of a conversational AI for mental-health support (Bachelor’s Thesis Project).* - **Developed and deployed** a chatbot using **Dialogflow CX**, **Telegram API**, and **Gemini AI** models, managing over **1 000+ conversations** with an **85% completion rate**. - **Implemented** advanced **NLP** and **clustering algorithms** (UMAP, HDBSCAN, sentiment analysis via Gemini API) to detect **7

conversational AI for mental-health support (Bachelor’s Thesis Project).* - **Developed and deployed** a chatbot using **Dialogflow CX**, **Telegram API**, and **Gemini AI** models, managing over **1 000+ conversations** with an **85% completion rate**. - **Implemented** advanced **NLP** and **clustering algorithms** (UMAP, HDBSCAN, sentiment analysis via Gemini API) to detect **7 distinct behavioral clusters** based on user emotional patterns. - **Engineered** real-time data pipelines connecting Telegram, BigQuery, and Power BI for **live monitoring** of user interactions and engagement metrics. - **Performed** statistical modeling and regression analysis in **R**, identifying relationships between user habits and emotional states. - **Designed** interactive dashboards in **Power BI** visualizing emotion trends and user segmentation results. - Outcomes presented in my bachelor’s thesis, demonstrating an integration of **AI, statistical reasoning, and human-centric design**. **Key Tools:** Dialogflow CX, Gemini API, Python, R, BigQuery, Power BI, FastAPI, Scikit-learn, HDBSCAN, UMAP. --- ### 🌍 Data Analytics & Market Research Intern — Italian–South African Chamber of Trade and Industries 📍 *Johannesburg, South Africa* | *Jan 2025 – Mar 2025* - **Conducted** 4 in-depth **market analyses** across *energy, steel, and agri-food* sectors, identifying high-growth opportunities (>20% annual growth potential). - **Supported** partnership and export strategies between Italian and South African enterprises by preparing data-driven market reports and trend analyses. - **Built** an internal **market-intelligence database** using Excel and Power BI, automating data pipelines and reducing information-retrieval time from **3 minutes to < 15 seconds per query**. - **Enhanced** strategic decision-making efficiency through real-time dashboards and interactive visual analytics. - Developed a **data-governance and version-control workflow** ensuring traceability of datasets and analyses. **Key Tools:** Power BI, Excel Automation, ETL Pipelines, Market Forecasting, Data Visualization. --- ## Technical Skills ### Programming & Data - **Languages:** Python (advanced), R (advanced), SQL (advanced) - **Frameworks & Libraries:** NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face, FastAPI, LangChain. - **APIs & LLMs:** Gemini API, OpenAI API, Datapizza AI Agents. - **Version Control:** Git, GitHub Actions, Docker (basic). ### Databases & Big Data - **Relational:** MySQL, PostgreSQL, Google BigQuery - **Non-Relational:** MongoDB - **Big Data Frameworks:** Spark, Hadoop, Databricks, ETL Pipelines. - **Cloud & Deployment:** Render, Railway, Google Cloud Storage, CORS Configuration. ### Machine Learning & AI - **Supervised Learning:** regression, classification, ensemble (XGBoost, Random Forest). - **Unsupervised Learning:** clustering (HDBSCAN, K-means), dimensionality reduction (UMAP, PCA). - **NLP:** sentiment analysis, topic modeling, LLM fine-tuning. - **Model Evaluation:** cross-validation, confusion matrix, ROC-AUC, RMSE. ### Data Visualization & Reporting - **Tools:** Power BI, Tableau, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly, ggplot2. - **Skills:** data storytelling, interactive dashboards, visual analytics, RMarkdown reporting. ### MLOps & System Design - **Data Pipelines:** ETL automation, vector database integration for RAG, API orchestration. - **Monitoring:** model logging, real-time analytics with BigQuery + Power BI. - **Software Architecture:** object-oriented design, microservices, REST API deployment. --- ## Projects & Applied Research ### 🧩 Mental-Health Conversational AI (Bachelor’s Thesis, NTT Data) - # Projects — Francesco Colasurdo ## Mental Health Conversational AI (NTT Data, Naples) Role: Data Science Intern Period: Mar 2025 – Jun 2025 Location: Naples, Italy ### Problem Mental well-being conversations are sensitive, high-volume, and highly contextual. The company needed a scalable conversational AI capable of interacting with users, detecting emotional state, and producing actionable insights for analysis — in real time. ### What I built - I designed and deployed a mental health chatbot using Dialogflow CX integrated with Telegram. - I connected the chatbot to Google BigQuery and collected >1,000 conversations. - I implemented clustering and sentiment analysis to identify behavioral patterns in users. ### Technical Stack - Dialogflow CX (intent detection, conversation flow) - Telegram Bot API (interaction layer) - Gemini API (LLM-based sentiment and emotional tone detection) - HDBSCAN + UMAP (unsupervised clustering of conversation embeddings) - R (regression analysis, exploratory data analysis, hypothesis testing) - Power BI (interactive dashboards for insights and storytelling) - BigQuery (data storage, querying, live monitoring) ### Impact - >85% completion rate on conversations. - 7 recurring behavioral clusters discovered across users. - Built real-time dashboards that visualized emotional trends and engagement. - This project formed the core of my Bachelor's thesis. --- ## Market Intelligence Automation (Italian–South African Chamber of Trade and Industries) Role: Data Analytics & Market Research Intern Period: Jan 2025 – Mar 2025 Location: Johannesburg, South Africa ### Problem Business partners and export stakeholders needed fast, data-backed answers about high-growth sectors (energy, steel, agri-food). The manual process to gather this info was slow (several minutes per query) and not standardized. ### What I built - I produced 4 full market analyses identifying >20% annual growth opportunities in strategic sectors. - I built an internal market-intelligence database and automated data collection and reporting flows. - I connected Excel data sources and Power BI dashboards to deliver near-instant answers. ### Technical Stack - Power BI (dashboards, KPIs, trend visualization) - Excel automation (ETL-like internal workflow) - Data cleaning and consolidation for repeatable intelligence ### Impact - Reduced time-to-answer from ~3 minutes to <15 seconds. - Improved decision-making speed for strategic partnership and export opportunities between Italian and South African firms. - Helped leadership maintain updated sector views without manual digging. --- ## Ask My CV — Personal RAG Assistant Role: Creator / Architect Period: 2025 – ongoing Location: Eindhoven / Remote ### Problem Recruiters and collaborators often ask similar questions: "What have you worked on?", "What are your skills?", "What motivates you?". Most personal websites are static and do not reflect the real depth of a profile. ### What I built - I designed a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) backend in Python using FastAPI. - I store my personal knowledge base as Markdown files (cv.md, skills.md, courses.md, projects.md, about_me.md). - I generate embeddings, perform cosine-similarity retrieval, and build first-person answers ("I worked on..."). - I integrated a lightweight chat widget into my personal website (Hugo + JS) so visitors can ask questions. ### Technical Stack - FastAPI (Python API /api/chat)

base as Markdown files (cv.md, skills.md, courses.md, projects.md, about_me.md). - I generate embeddings, perform cosine-similarity retrieval, and build first-person answers ("I worked on..."). - I integrated a lightweight chat widget into my personal website (Hugo + JS) so visitors can ask questions. ### Technical Stack - FastAPI (Python API /api/chat) - sentence-transformers for embeddings - cosine similarity search over vectors.json - datapizza-ai for agent orchestration and tool calling - custom prompt engineering ("speak in first person, don't hallucinate") - front-end chat widget embedded in a Hugo static site ### Impact - Live, interactive portfolio instead of static CV. - Lets me explain projects, values, experiences, motivations in my own voice. - Helps me stand out to recruiters as someone who builds, not just studies. --- ## Blockchain / DeFi Research & Personal Studies Role: Independent Researcher / Enthusiast Period: 2021 – 2024 ### Focus - Studied decentralized finance (DeFi) from a technological, economic, and philosophical viewpoint. - Explored incentive design, tokenomics, and game theory in decentralized systems. - Investigated how Bitcoin and blockchain challenge traditional power structures in terms of privacy, self-custody, financial sovereignty, and censorship resistance. ### Why it matters - This mindset influences how I approach AI ethics, data ownership, and digital autonomy. - I am interested in aligning AI with individual freedom, transparency, and accountability – not just performance. ### Keywords `DeFi`, `blockchain`, `Bitcoin philosophy`, `privacy`, `self-sovereignty`, `tokenomics`, `game theory`, `financial inclusion`, `decentralization`, `tech for freedom`.

# Thesis & Internship Project — Intelligent ChatBot for Psychological Well-being ## Overview As part of my Bachelor's degree in **Statistics for Big Data** at the **University of Salerno (UNISA)**, I completed an internship and thesis project at **NTT Data Italia, Naples**, within the **Digital Linguistics & Human Behaviour Team**. The project focused on the **design, implementation, and statistical analysis** of a conversational AI system aimed at supporting **mental health and emotional self-awareness** through data-driven interaction. ## Objectives - Design and deploy an **AI-powered conversational assistant** for psychological well-being monitoring. - Integrate advanced **Natural Language Processing (NLP)** with **statistical learning** and **data visualization**. - Collect, preprocess, and analyze **real user-chat data** to extract behavioral and emotional insights. - Build a **scalable, privacy-compliant data pipeline** for continuous improvement of the chatbot. ## System Architecture ### Core Components 1. **DialogFlow CX (Google Cloud)** — primary conversational flow engine. - Designed multi-flow architecture (emotion flows: happiness, sadness, anxiety, boredom). - Combined deterministic and generative routes for robust intent handling. - Integrated custom Generators powered by **Google Gemini 1.5 Flash** for sentiment understanding. 2. **Telegram Bot API + Node.js Middleware** - Developed a custom **API layer** to bridge Telegram and DialogFlow CX. - Implemented a three-tier model: **User Interface (Telegram)** → **Middleware (Node.js)** → **Conversational Engine (DialogFlow CX)**. - Managed user sessions, webhooks, and asynchronous message streaming. 3. **Google BigQuery (Data Warehouse)** - Real-time storage of conversation logs in **JSON format**. - Complex **SQL queries and CTEs** for flattening nested JSON data. - Data anonymization and parameter extraction (e.g., sleep hours, stress level, productivity). 4. **Statistical & Machine Learning Layer (R Language)** - Conducted advanced **Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)** on structured data. - Applied **Regression Analysis**, **DBSCAN**, and **HDBSCAN** clustering. - Implemented **TF-IDF**, **sBERT embeddings**, and **UMAP** for textual feature representation and dimensionality reduction. - Evaluated cluster validity with **Silhouette Score** and **Dunn Index**. 5. **Visualization Layer (Power BI)** - Built interactive dashboards to display emotional trends, routine correlations, and ChatBot performance metrics. - Enabled dynamic filtering by emotion, activity, and user behavior. --- ## Data Pipeline Summary 1. **Data Acquisition:** Conversations stored in BigQuery in real-time via DialogFlow logs. 2. **Parsing & Wrangling:** Flattened nested JSON structures with SQL (`JSON_VALUE`, `REGEXP_EXTRACT`, `LAG`, `DATETIME_DIFF`). 3. **Feature Engineering:** Extracted behavioral and emotional parameters per session (diet, sleep, hydration, productivity, anxiety level). 4. **Text Preprocessing:** Tokenization, lemmatization, stopword removal, lowercasing, and normalization for uniformity. 5. **Numerical Representation:** - TF-IDF for lexical similarity. - **sBERT (Sentence-BERT)** embeddings for semantic similarity. 6. **Dimensionality Reduction:** UMAP projections for cluster visualization. 7. **Clustering & Analysis:** - DBSCAN → density-based clusters of similar messages. - HDBSCAN → hierarchical and noise-tolerant clusters. 8. **Evaluation & Insights:** Computed silhouette width and Dunn index to assess cluster cohesion and separation. --- ## Key Results & Insights - **Identified behavioral patterns** correlating sleep duration, hydration, and self-reported productivity. - Clustered emotional states into distinct profiles (e.g., anxiety-driven users vs. happiness clusters). - Detected **linguistic signatures** tied to emotional states using TF-IDF and sBERT representations. -

to assess cluster cohesion and separation. --- ## Key Results & Insights - **Identified behavioral patterns** correlating sleep duration, hydration, and self-reported productivity. - Clustered emotional states into distinct profiles (e.g., anxiety-driven users vs. happiness clusters). - Detected **linguistic signatures** tied to emotional states using TF-IDF and sBERT representations. - The ChatBot demonstrated **adaptive sentiment recognition** through real-time LLM (Gemini) feedback loops. - Achieved a **mean silhouette score of 0.31 (TF-IDF)** and **0.27 (sBERT)** with well-separated semantic clusters. - Generated a Power BI dashboard enabling **business and behavioral analytics** on user emotional states. --- ## Technical Stack | Category | Technologies & Tools | |-----------|----------------------| | Conversational AI | **Google DialogFlow CX**, **Google Gemini LLMs**, **Prompt Engineering (CO-STAR, Zero-Shot, Few-Shot)** | | Data Storage | **Google BigQuery**, SQL (CTE, JSON parsing, query optimization) | | Backend Integration | **Node.js**, **Telegram Bot API**, **Webhooks**, **Local Server Bridge** | | Data Science & ML | **R Language**, **TF-IDF**, **sBERT**, **UMAP**, **DBSCAN**, **HDBSCAN**, **Clustering Validation Metrics** | | Visualization | **Microsoft Power BI**, interactive reports, trend dashboards | | Cloud & Dev Tools | **Google Cloud Platform**, **VSCode**, **GitHub**, **JSON**, **CSV**, **APIs** | --- ## Methodological Highlights - **Prompt Engineering:** Designed controlled prompts for consistent sentiment classification (Gemini-based generator). - **Unsupervised Learning:** Used density-based clustering to detect recurring psychological topics in open-ended responses. - **NLP Pipeline:** Combined symbolic NLP (TF-IDF) and transformer-based embeddings (sBERT). - **Dimensionality Reduction:** Applied UMAP to visualize text embeddings and improve clustering interpretability. - **Statistical Validation:** Used correlation matrices (Spearman) to link daily habits with emotional outcomes. --- ## Impact & Contributions - Delivered a **fully functional conversational system** that collects and analyzes user emotional data in real time. - Designed a **scalable, cloud-based pipeline** for conversational data engineering and behavioral analysis. - Demonstrated how **AI and Data Science can enhance digital mental health monitoring**. - Provided empirical insights into the **relationship between habits, lifestyle, and emotional states**. - Enabled a reproducible workflow for future **AI-driven psychometric studies**. --- ## Competencies Developed - Conversational AI engineering (DialogFlow CX, NLP design). - Data engineering with Google Cloud BigQuery (ETL, SQL on JSON). - Statistical modeling and clustering in R. - NLP pipeline development (TF-IDF, embeddings, transformers). - Machine learning validation and interpretability. - Dashboarding and data storytelling (Power BI). - Prompt engineering and LLM fine-tuning principles. - Cross-functional collaboration in a corporate AI environment (NTT Data). --- ## Keywords **ChatBot Development**, **Mental Health AI**, **DialogFlow CX**, **Google Gemini**, **Natural Language Processing**, **BigQuery**, **Data Wrangling**, **TF-IDF**, **sBERT**, **UMAP**, **Clustering**, **DBSCAN**, **HDBSCAN**, **R Programming**, **Power BI Dashboards**, **Machine Learning**, **Sentiment Analysis**, **Prompt Engineering**, **Zero-Shot Learning**, **AI for Human Well-being**, **Digital Linguistics**, **Statistical Modeling**, **Behavioral Analytics**, **Google Cloud**, **Telegram API**, **Data Visualization**, **LLM Integration**, **Conversational Intelligence**. --- ## Summary Sentence (for Retrieval) Developed a full-stack AI conversational system using **DialogFlow CX, Google Gemini, BigQuery, and R** to support **mental health analysis**, performing **statistical modeling, NLP preprocessing, unsupervised clustering, and behavioral analytics** on real user-chat data collected through **Telegram API** and visualized via **Power

Integration**, **Conversational Intelligence**. --- ## Summary Sentence (for Retrieval) Developed a full-stack AI conversational system using **DialogFlow CX, Google Gemini, BigQuery, and R** to support **mental health analysis**, performing **statistical modeling, NLP preprocessing, unsupervised clustering, and behavioral analytics** on real user-chat data collected through **Telegram API** and visualized via **Power BI**.
